snippet: The Financial Stability Oversight Council will examine the riskiness of some nonbanks in an effort to place stronger regulations on important financial institutions.
abstract: Financial Stability Oversight Council moves closer to increasing its oversight of nonbank financial institutions, including hedge funds, private equity firms and insurers; council votes unanimously to adopt a rule provided for in the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act that will designate firms as 'systemically important financial institutions' and put them under stronger regulatory supervision.
lead_paragraph: The Financial Stability Oversight Council will examine the riskiness of some nonbanks in an effort to place stronger regulations on important financial institutions.

headline.seo: Regulators Move Closer to Scrutinizing Nonbanks
headline.main: Regulators Move Closer to Oversight of Nonbanks
headline.print_headline: Regulators Move Closer to Oversight of Nonbanks

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
